Package edu.umn.cs.csci3081w.project.model

Class RandomPassengerGenerator

java.lang.Object
edu.umn.cs.csci3081w.project.model.PassengerGenerator
edu.umn.cs.csci3081w.project.model.RandomPassengerGenerator
public class RandomPassengerGenerator extends PassengerGenerator
Generates passengers randomly based on probabilities assigned to stops. The RandomPassengerGenerator class uses probabilistic logic to determine the number of passengers arriving at each stop. It supports deterministic behavior for testing.

  • Field Details

    • DETERMINISTIC

      public static boolean DETERMINISTIC
      Flag to enable deterministic testing. If true, the generator uses predefined deterministic values for passenger generation.

    • DETERMINISTIC_VALUE

      public static final double DETERMINISTIC_VALUE

  • Method Details

    • generatePassengers

      public int generatePassengers()
      Generates Passengers. This method uses the route's passenger generation probabilities per stop to determine how many passengers to create. Each probability is a double, i.e., .90 for a 90% probability of a passenger arriving at a stop for this vehicle route. While the probability is greater than .0001 (.01%), we attempt to generate passengers. Each time, we multiply the probability by itself, redoing the likelihood of additional passengers each time. This controls for multiple passengers arriving at a given time. Once the probability drops below .0001, we end our generation cycle for the stop.
      Specified by:
      generatePassengers in class PassengerGenerator
      Returns:
      number of generated passengers
